data.title: Some Visual Script Bugs
data.body:
1-Variable view not updated when created or edited
2-Variables with export set are not updated or displayed in inspetor
3-Is the horizontal scroll default ok?

data.title: Fixed syntax inconsistency in Vector3.snap and Vector3.snapped
data.body:
Changed Vector3.snap(real_t) to Vector3.snap(Vector3) and Vector3.snapped(real_t) to Vector3.snapped(Vector3).

Changed Vector3.snap/Vector3.snapped function calls to use the new syntax.

closes #9451

data.title: Sending InputEvent with rpc over network doesn't work properly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.2 alpha compiled with VS2015

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
rpc_id( 1, "receive_input", event)
should call receive_input(event) on server but event change from source to destination.
example:
original InputEvent sent:
Device 0 ID 279 Event: Key Unicode:  Scan: 16777231 Echo: True PressedTrue
InputEvent received:
Device 0 ID 0 Event: Key Unicode:  Scan: 16777231 Echo: False PressedFalse


**Steps to reproduce:**
-Open the project in two instances
-Click on server in one instance
-Click on client in the other.
-Perform inputs on client window
-Look console outputs

**Link to minimal example project:**
[input_event_issue.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1116079/input_event_issue.zip)

data.title: Buildsystem: Improve detect.py readability and fix issues
data.body:
Tried to organize the configure(env) calls in sections, using the same order
for all platforms whenever possible.

Apart from cosmetic changes, the following issues were fixed:
- Android: cleanup linkage, remove GLESv1_CM and GLESv2
- iPhone: Remove obsolete "ios_gles22_override" option
- OSX:
  * Fix bits detection (default to 64) and remove obsolete "force_64_bits" option
    (closes #9449)
  * Make "fat" bits argument explicit
- Server: sync with X11
- Windows: clean up old DirectX 9 stuff
- X11:
  * Do not require system OpenSSL for building (closes #9443)
  * Fix typo'ed use_leak_sanitizer option
  * Fix .llvm suffix overriding custom extra_suffix

-----

### Testers needed for all platforms!

I'm pretty sure I messed up most of the platforms, so please test this PR for all the platforms you are used to building for, and check that no regression appeared. I'll fix them as you find them.

Tested:
- [x] Linux X11, GCC
- [x] Linux X11, Clang
- [x] Linux Server (only init, build fails due to #8361)
- [x] Windows, MSVC
- [ ] Windows, MinGW on Windows
- [x] Windows, MinGW on Linux
- [x] OSX, Clang
- [x] Android from Linux
- [ ] Android from Windows
- [ ] Android from macOS
- [x] iPhone ARM
- [x] iPhone simulator
- [ ] Javascript
- [x] UWP
- [ ] Haiku
- [ ] FreeBSD
- [ ] OpenBSD

data.title: Fix Tileset/tilemap issues related to my adding of one-way collisions to them
data.body:
Also, turn `shape_offset` into `shape_transform`, since otherwise you can have only down-pointing one-way collisions.

Fix bad return type in CollisionObject2D, Shape -> Shape2D. Was causing unintended null when casting. (#9409)
Fix a misplaced ++ operator. (#9370)
Fix merging with exiting tileset duplicating shapes. (#9370)

![captura de tela de 2017-06-30 07-53-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85936/27732889-c662faea-5d69-11e7-89a9-389717eea602.png)

data.title: Syntax inconsistency snapping 2D and 3D vectors
data.body:
**Godot version: master**

Vector2.snapped uses a Vector2 as parameter and Vector3.snapped uses a float as parameter, this makes the later not straightforward to snap into a not regular (cube) grid.

Making Vector3.snapped to use a Vector3 parameter (breaking change) will be better for the snapped purpose and will be consistent with the syntax of its 2D counterpart.

data.title: Mouse click has a weird behaviour ?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
- Windows 7 Pro, Service Pack 1
- 64 bits
- Godot_v2.1.3-stable_win64

**Issue description:**
I noticed a problem with the buttons (and scrollbars) and the mouse inputs.
Actually, when you hold another mouse button than the left button (so, right button, wheel button, etc), then you press the left click, then you release the other button, and finally you release the left click, the button appears pressed but is not considered as pressed.
Same problem for the scrollbar buttons.
(Note that the problem happens also when you hold two other buttons than the left)
It's something which happens very rarely (I discovered it by accident), but it can happen with all Godot's buttons (including these in the editor).

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Press Right-click with mouse over a button and hold it
- Press Left-click and hold it, with the previous right-click holded.
- Release Right-Click
- Release Left-Click
(It also works with the wheel-click instead of Right-Click)

Thanks !

data.title: Default "bits" for OSX platform should be 64
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OSX, 2.1 and master.

**Issue description:**
When the `bits` argument is not specified when building for OSX, it defaults to 32-bit. OSX is pretty much 64-bit only nowadays, so it should default to 64.

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/osx/detect.py#L41-L42

data.title: EditorNode: request attention when quit while minimized
data.body: Only when save/quit dialog appears. It won't request attention when quit_confirmation = false and no changes is made.

data.title: EditorNode: mark opened deleted scenes as unsaved
data.body: This might prevent accidental data loss when scenes are deleted (either using FileSystemDock or deleted in the OS file manager) while they're still open in the editor. This PR marks them as unsaved so the editor asks if they need to be saved before closing.

data.title: AnimationPlayer has both playback_* and playback/* properties
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All, current master branch.

**Issue description:**
AnimationPlayer has two "Playback" categories in the inspector:
![spectacle ns2442](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4701338/27700308-81bd819c-5cfd-11e7-9077-30153043c4f7.png)
It's due to it have properties prefixed by `playback_` (new style properties) and others by `playback/` (old style properties):
```
playback_process_mode
playback_default_blend_time
playback/active
playback/play
playback/speed
```

It should probably be fixed by making the `playback/` stuff use the new style, but it apparently implies messing around with SceneStringNames.

data.title: .obj material surfaces aren't imported.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
LMDE - Godot master branch.

**Issue description:**
Godot ignore surfaces included in "Wavefront" .obj files. Whatever the amount of materials in the model there is always one material in MeshInstance inspector.

**Steps to reproduce:**
-Create a mesh with several materials in your favorite modeling software and export the model as a .obj file.
-Include this file in a MeshInstance.
-Check the number of materials in the inspector.

data.title: [TRACKER] GPU/driver-specific issues
data.body:
This tracker lists GPU driver-specific issues that affect the new renderer in Godot 3.x.

- [ ] OpenGL error: GL_INVALID_OPERATION in DisableVertexAttribArray [intel, Windows] #7906
- [ ] Stream of errors when enabling refraction and SSS [radeon, Windows] #9139 
- [ ] GL error spam when using a viewport (Sampler object 0 is bound to non-depth texture 0) [nvidia, Linux] #9335
- [ ] OpenGL fragment and vertex shader error spam [nvidia, Windows] #9434
- [ ] graphical issues with material_tester demo [intel, Linux] #9525

data.title: [RFE] Animation Player emit events
data.body:
Allow adding points in an animation that will emit a signal from the player. This will allow you to attach code to be invoked at certain points in the animation.

Example of feature from Spline 2D:
https://youtu.be/gPj9ZkSb0gU

data.title: Font hinting causing chunky fonts
data.body:
godot 3.0 on linux.

![chunky_fonts](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11153232/27677133-b9e32d3c-5cef-11e7-9241-67ddd99a7b95.png)

Discussing with Akien:
Most likely we need to initialize a freetype parameter that changed its default value. If the editor is not affected, it might be that it inits it properly, but not the non-tools runtime.

Probably something connected with this commit: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/0f8cc0fa5b6bc53b81fbf3fe52c15be987dfd7c2

The cursor keeps is resizer shape instead of getting back the arrow one.

Open the editor parameters and cross slowly of one of its borders.

data.title: Panel widths are not loaded upon opening/creating projects
data.body: Editor layouts do save the widths of each panel correctly, but when opening up a project they don't seem to be applied. For the saved width information to be loaded you must manually load the layouts upon opening the project each time. Even saving the layout as Default doesn't fix this. This happens on both 2.1.3 and 3.0.

data.title: Local to scene resources don't work if they are sub-resources
data.body:
This seemed to good to be true, but local to scene resources will not work when they are not contained in a node. If they are contained in a sub-resource they will simply not work.

This needs some considerable work in PackedScene, but will leave for later as there are other priorities.
Referencing this issue in workaround of "gui in 3D" demo.

data.title: [3.0] Fixed NinePatches not working on HTML5
Crash on mac simulator (https calls)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS 10.12.4, Godot 2.1.3-stable

**Issue description:**
In my project I'm using simple gd script for collecting game analytics in amplitude. It uses https protocol. Every several minutes the godot simulator (not on real device) crashes with this stack:

```
Thread 5 Crashed:: _load
0   org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ebb8e2f X509_NAME_cmp + 47
1   org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ec2639b OBJ_bsearch_ex_ + 123
2   org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ebf72d5 internal_find + 117
3   org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ebae9a9 X509_OBJECT_retrieve_match + 25
4   org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ebae8fa X509_STORE_add_cert + 234
5   org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ec7221b StreamPeerOpenSSL::connect(Ref<StreamPeer>, bool, String const&) + 411
6   org.godotengine.godot         	0x0000000110257ed4 HTTPClient::poll() + 2836
7   org.godotengine.godot         	0x0000000110264575 MethodBind0R<HTTPClient, Error>::call(Object*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) + 245
8   org.godotengine.godot         	0x00000001100b1655 Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) + 421
9   org.godotengine.godot         	0x0000000110164ec4 Variant::call_ptr(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant*, Variant::CallError&) + 276
10  org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010eab8a1e GDFunction::call(GDInstance*, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&, GDFunction::CallState*) + 7294
11  org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010eb0d523 GDInstance::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) + 179
12  org.godotengine.godot         	0x00000001100b1547 Object::call(StringName const&, Variant const**, int, Variant::CallError&) + 151
13  org.godotengine.godot         	0x00000001103054f3 _Thread::_start_func(void*) + 355
14  org.godotengine.godot         	0x000000010ed8b5ae ThreadPosix::thread_callback(void*) + 30
15  libsystem_pthread.dylib       	0x00007fff9be6d9af _pthread_body + 180
16  libsystem_pthread.dylib       	0x00007fff9be6d8fb _pthread_start + 286
17  libsystem_pthread.dylib       	0x00007fff9be6d101 thread_start + 13
```

The crash looks like it not dependent on something specific game action. It can occur while application is starting or after 10-15 minutes of gameplay. 

**Steps to reproduce:**

Use https calls hard.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: [WIP] Add support for Sailfish OS
data.body:
Hello.

I have been working on porting the engine to the [Sailfish](https://sailfishos.org/) operating system.
I decided to open this PR to track progress and invite other interested parties to join the effort.

Sailfish is a Linux-based operating system for mobile devices.
It uses a lot of the common platform software stack like D-Bus, systemd, PulseAudio, Qt and others.
It also uses Wayland instead of x server.

This is a work in progress. Here is what works at the moment.

- [x] Rendering. The port uses QOpenGlWindow for accelerated drawing.
- [x] Audio. Reusing the PA driver we already have. Also uses `libaudioresource` to manage permissions.
- [x] Mouse and keyboard input.
- [ ] Touch events are not sent (easy).
- [ ] Landscape mode. Investigating how to implement landscape mode. May need to rotate canvas and translate input.
- [ ] Exporter. SailfishOS uses RPM package format. My idea is to export the project files to a directory with a `.spec` file and call `spectacle` to generate the RPM. This way we will not introduce any additional dependencies like `librpm` nor resort to manually generating the RPM.

data.title: 3.0 is slower that 2.1.3
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0, 2.1.3, Windows 10 x64

**Issue description:**
Godot 3.0 is 2-3 times slower than 2.1.3
Created a project with the same logic:
300 objects initialized from scene : Path -> PathFollow -> Sprite
190fps vs 90fps.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26034850/27619567-67d6f15e-5b91-11e7-85fd-afacf35d53b7.png)

3.0 is a lot more beautiful, but still
